query.queryString: (/article/relations/categories/collection/code='resultsPack,projectsInfoPack,brief' OR (/result/relations/categories/collection/code='deliverable,publication' OR contenttype='project')) AND ('SUSTAINABILITY' OR 'INNOVATION' OR 'MULTI-CRITERIA')

warnings.message: One of the fields on which a sort was requested does not exist

result.title: Paper on farmer and breeder preferences for breeding and genetics
result.description: Outcomes from semi-structured interviews (T7.2) summarising the benefits, barriers and challenges for breeding programs and improving resilience and efficiency of animals and farms

result.title: Scientific manuscript source code with prediction models for trade-offs under nutritional and infectious challenges
result.description: In this deliverable, we will provide the source code and a draft paper consisting of detailed descriptions of model scope, assumptions, methodology and predictions of resilience trajectories for two types of trade-offs, generated by either nutritional or infectious challenges

result.title: Report on demography and genetic diversity of underutilized sheep and goat breeds

result.title: Paper on quantification (genetic and phenotypic parameters) of new disease biomarkers linked to production. New disease phenotypes for endemic disease (proxies for foot rot, mastitis, parasites) linked to key production traits phenotypes

result.title: Document specifying the exchange of pedigree, phenotypes and genotypes
result.description: It describes the specifications of the way to exchange and store the pedigree, phenotypes and genotypes from the different countries involved in the across country evaluation. It is intended to describe a common international pedigree file with all aliases, as well as file formats for exchanging genotypes/phenotypes

result.title: A manuscript on the development and testing of genomic evaluation tools to improve resilience and efficiency accounting for the impact of environmental challenge and using novel phenotypes
result.description: Environmental challenges and new phenotypes related to resilience and efficiency can now be measured, but methods for their inclusion in genomic evaluation are still scarce. We will develop such methods to include environmental measures and novel phenotypes, and test them in real life data sets.

result.title: Paper on economic, labour and environmental trade-offs for breeding for R&E traits
result.description: Outputs from the modelling in task 7.1 presenting the economic, labour and environmental values for production and R&E traits. Propose how to combine all traits into a balanced breeding goal

result.title: Report on trajectory characteristics of resilient animals, and strategies to manipulate these
result.description: In this deliverable, we will provide a report that lists trajectory characteristics that discriminate animals with high and low resilience to nutritional and infectious challenges (identified from model and data analyses), and describes the effect of diverse control strategies on these, based on model predictions

result.title: Business and operation model for international evaluation of rams and bucks
result.description: It describes the business and operation model for international evaluation of rams and bucks. This deliverable consists in a specification of a ready-to-implement routine international evaluation infrastructure. This deliverable also describes the outline, expectations and organisations of a reference centre for small ruminants.

result.title: Method for assessing potential bias due to design of cross-validation analysis
result.description: Crossvalidation studies in small ruminants may underestimate benefit accuracy and genetic progress of genomic selection due to short size of studies and the use of selected animals We will describe a crossvalidation method that generates meaningful estimates of accuracy and expected genetic progress from genomic selection

result.title: Report on cost-effectiveness of harmonization in phenotyping and of international evaluation
result.description: This is a report on cost-effectiveness of harmonization in phenotyping and of international evaluation. This deliverable will be a tool to promote international evaluation by showing how cost-effective sharing information, especially in the genomic area.

result.title: Submitted scientific publication on the genetic parameters between efficiency, resilience and reproduction related traits in sheep and goats
result.description: This deliverable will provide genetic correlations between efficiency and resilience related traits in order to identify synergy andor tradeoffs under genetic control Additional traits related to reproduction will also be considered To do so a set of existing data from partners SRUC INRAE INIA UNILEON will be used as well as data produced in WP1 and WP2

result.title: Paper on genome-wide association studies (GWAS) for at least 10 new resilience traits in 6 breeds
result.description: Using existing genomic data and new genomic information, genomic regions affecting survival and health traits will be identified. Putative candidate genes will be searched in these regions in order to propose causative mutations.

result.description: The use of new technologic tools (like temperature measured with ruminal bolus, animal movement measured with GPS, artificial rearing measured with automates, lamb survival measured using ultrasound scan at key time…), will allow to identify new phenotypes to measure on farm.

result.title: ICAR guidelines and recommendations for phenotyping efficiency and resilience traits in sheep and goats.
result.description: The document is the ICAR guidelines and recommendations for phenotyping efficiency and resilience traits in sheep and goats. These recommendations will be published in ICAR guidelines and are in the scope of the sheep, goat and small camelids working group. All the traits proposed by WP1 and WP3 to be implemented on farm or on station will have specific recommendations.

result.title: Submitted scientific publication on the variance components for pilot ruminants breeds in a pilot selection of countries
result.description: The document includes one or several scientific publication on the variance components estimated in pilot ruminants breeds in a pilot panel of countries. The variance components are the genetic parameters required to carry out international evaluation. In particular, the genetic correlation between countries will be published.

result.title: Report on the characterization of efficiency and resilience in lines of sheep and goat divergently selected
result.description: In this deliverable, we will report the result from 4 experiments in genetically selected sheep and goat which will undergo both nutritional and infectious challenges. We thus will characterize the effect of genetic background and environmental stress (nutrition, infection) on a comprehensive set of efficiency- and resilience- related phenotypes.
